body.p: Having concluded that the lessee’s right to use the underlying asset meets the definition of an asset and the lessee’s obligation to make lease payments meets the definition of a liability (as described in paragraphs BC22–BC40), the IASB then considered whether requiring a lessee to recognise that asset and liability for all leases would improve financial reporting to the extent that the benefits from the improvements would outweigh the costs associated with such a change.
